alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Ford; Meade; Pawnee; Seward (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 08 at 2:43PM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Pawnee, Ford and Edwards Counties. * WHEN...From 3 PM Monday to 6 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The combination of accumulating snow and intense north winds will produce widespread blowing and drifting snow. Visibility will be near zero at times, especially on open rural highways, and especially Monday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winter driving conditions will spread rapidly and abruptly eastward Monday afternoon into Monday night. Conditions will change quickly over short times and distances, and motorists are urged to be prepared for the onset of dangerous travel.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
